What method was used for the magnetic characterization of Cu(1,3-bdc)?
data.answer: DC magnetic susceptibility data were collected using Quantum Design MPMS-5S and MPMS-XL SQUID magnetometers.

data.question: What structural feature distinguishes Cu(1,3-bdc)·0.11 H2O from Cu(1,3-bdc)?
data.answer: Cu(1,3-bdc)·0.11 H2O contains a partially occupied water molecule on a special position, which is not present in Cu(1,3-bdc).

data.question: True or False: The crystal structure of C32H24Cu6O26 contains a 16-membered ring with Cu(1) and Cu(2) in pseudo-square planar coordination environments.
What is the role of Cu(OH)F in the synthesis of Cu(1,3-bdc)?
data.answer: Cu(OH)F was included as a mineralizing agent to promote crystal formation.

data.question: How was the purity of Cu(1,3-bdc) confirmed?
data.answer: The purity of Cu(1,3-bdc) was confirmed by similarities between simulated and experimental powder X-ray diffraction (pXRD) and by elemental analysis.

data.question: What was the outcome of heating Cu(1,3-bdc) crystals to 240 °C before magnetic measurements?
data.answer: Heating Cu(1,3-bdc) crystals to 240 °C before magnetic measurements removed the incidental solvent molecule without significant decomposition of the sample.

data.question: True or False: The structure of C32H24Cu6O26 provides evidence of oxidation of 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate in the 2-position under the synthesis conditions.
What was the significance of the 2.9714(5) Å distance in the structure of C32H24Cu6O26?
data.answer: The 2.9714(5) Å distance in the structure of C32H24Cu6O26 is the distance between Cu(1) and Cu(2), which is within bonding distance for two Cu(II) ions.

data.question: True or False: The packing diagram of C32H24Cu6O26 viewed along the c axis shows that the 16-membered ring is planar.
